1 - Working at the VUB

2 - Position description

The Faculty of Faculteit Letteren en Wijsbegeerte, Department Linguistics and Literary Studies, is looking for a tenure track lecturer. 

More concretely your work package contains: 

Education and Research domain:

French (applied) linguistics

Education tasks:

Research tasks:

Research in French (applied) linguistics, linking up with and strengthening one of the research priorities of the Center for Linguistics (CLIN), and one of the research priorities of the Brussels Institute for Applied Linguistics (BIAL).

Other tasks:

Participation in the administrative responsabilities of the research group(s), study program(s), department and faculty. Contributions in terms of outreach and community engagement, as well as in terms of internationalization. 

For this function, our Brussels Humanities, Sciences & Engineering Campus (Elsene) will serve as your home base. 

3 - Profile

What do we expect from you?

You have a diploma of doctor in French Linguistics or Applied Linguistics, or in a comparable, relevant domain.

  • As far as research is concerned, you can connect to and strengthen one of the research priorities of the Center for Linguistics (CLIN), and one of the research priorities of the Brussels Institute for Applied Linguistics (BIAL);
  • You perform sound scientific research in the relevant domains, demonstrable through (co-)authorship of publications listed in one of the categories of the VABB database;
  • You have experience in the teaching of French (applied) linguistics, and didactic qualities in line with the teaching duties, as evidenced in a trial teaching session (in the case of limited teaching experience) or based on student evaluations;
  • You are committed to research-based teaching, as shown in a clear vision on each of the courses to be taught;
  • You are an active member of international research network(s) or has a clear vision on how to develop and extend such a network;
  • You have experience in fundraising or has a clear vision on how to apply for funding, with an ambitious but realistic plan for the next five years;
  • You have a clear vision on scientific, methodological and societal engagement and on the involvement in the study programme(s), the department and the research group(s);
  • Multilingualism and international experience is an added value; non-Dutch-speaking candidates are expected to acquire Dutch at A2 level within two years, with a B2 level no later than five years after appointment; proficiency in English at a C1 level as well as a demonstrable basic proficiency in Dutch or ongoing efforts to acquire this before the start of the position are recommended.
  • You subscribe to the universityâs vision of education. The full text in relation to this is available on the university website.
  • Every first appointment is dependent upon the successful delivery of a teaching session.
  • Members of the academic staff who, as title-holders, are charged with teaching assignments, must be able to demonstrate the required knowledge of the language of instruction for the relevant course units. Example: When a course unit is taught in English, the candidate is required to have the appropriate certificate. More information about the regulations concerning the language proficiency you can find via https://jobs.vub.be/content/Regulations-concerning-language-proficiency/
